content:
GlyphTypeface Class

Definition

Specifies a physical font face that corresponds to a font file on the disk.

In this Article

public class GlyphTypeface : System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize
Inheritance
System.Object
GlyphTypeface

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The GlyphTypeface object is a low level text object that corresponds to a single face of a font family as represented by an OpenType font file, or serialized as a block of memory in a document. The correct GlyphTypeface to use for a run of characters in a given logical font is normally determined by the WPF font system and recorded in the GlyphRun objects generated by the FormattedText object and line formatting text APIs.

The GlyphTypeface provides properties and methods for:

  • Obtaining font face common metrics, such as the ratio of ascent and descent to em size.

  • Obtaining metrics, outlines, and bitmaps for individual glyphs.

  • Serialization in a document.

    The following list describes the type of application scenarios that illustrate the value of using the low-level control that the GlyphTypeface object provides.

  • A fixed format document generator may use the GlyphTypeface to obtain a binary image of the font for embedding in a document container

  • A printer driver may use the GlyphTypeface to obtain font glyph outlines or bitmaps, or the entire font image for sending to the printer.

  • A GlyphTypeface viewer application may use the GlyphTypeface to obtain metric and bitmap information.

    Each glyph defines metrics that specify how it aligns with other Glyphs. The following graphic defines metric values for glyph characters.


    Metric values of glyph characters

XAML Text Usage

Constructors

GlyphTypeface()

Initializes a new instance of the GlyphTypeface class.

public GlyphTypeface ();

GlyphTypeface(Uri)

Initializes a new instance of the GlyphTypeface class using the specified font file location.

public GlyphTypeface (Uri typefaceSource);
typefaceSource
Uri

The URI that specifies the location of the font file.

Remarks

This constructor creates a new GlyphTypeface object from an OpenType font face specified by typefaceSource. The constructed GlyphTypeface object does not use style simulations.

GlyphTypeface(Uri,StyleSimulations)

Initializes a new instance of the GlyphTypeface class using the specified font file location and StyleSimulations value.

public GlyphTypeface (Uri typefaceSource, System.Windows.Media.StyleSimulations styleSimulations);
typefaceSource
Uri

The URI that specifies the location of the font file.

styleSimulations
StyleSimulations

One of the StyleSimulations values.

Remarks

This constructor creates a new GlyphTypeface object from an OpenType font face specified by typefaceSource and styleSimulations.

Properties

AdvanceHeights

Gets the advance heights for the glyphs represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<ushort,double> AdvanceHeights { get; }
Value
IDictionary<UInt16,Double>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key-value pairs that represents advance height information for the glyphs. The key is a UInt16 that identifies the glyph index. The value is a Double that represents the advance height.

Remarks

The AdvanceHeights property is used for calculating vertical layout.

AdvanceWidths

Gets the advance widths for the glyphs represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<ushort,double> AdvanceWidths { get; }
Value
IDictionary<UInt16,Double>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represents advance width information for the glyphs. The key is a UInt16 that identifies the glyph index. The value is a Double that represents the advance width.

Remarks

The AdvanceHeights property is used for calculating horizontal layout.

Baseline

Gets the baseline value for the GlyphTypeface.

public double Baseline { get; }
Value
Double

A value of type Double that represents the baseline.

Remarks

The baseline value represents the distance from cell top to English baseline relative to em size.

BottomSideBearings

Gets the distance from bottom edge of the black box to the bottom end of the advance vector for the glyphs represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<ushort,double> BottomSideBearings { get; }
Value
IDictionary<UInt16,Double>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information. The key is a UInt16 that identifies the glyph. The value is a Double that represents the distance.

Remarks

The BottomSideBearings value is positive when the bottom edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance width and font cell height. The font cell height is a horizontal dimension in vertical layout.

The BottomSideBearings value is negative when the bottom edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.

CapsHeight

Gets the distance from the baseline to the top of an English capital, relative to em size, for the GlyphTypeface object.

public double CapsHeight { get; }
Value
Double

A Double that indicates the distance from the baseline to the top of an English capital letter, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

CharacterToGlyphMap

Gets the nominal mapping of a Unicode code point to a glyph index as defined by the font 'CMAP' table.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<int,ushort> CharacterToGlyphMap { get; }
Value
IDictionary<Int32,UInt16>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains the mapping of a Unicode code points to glyph indices for all glyphs in the GlyphTypeface object.

Copyrights

Gets the copyright information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> Copyrights { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent copyright information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a copyright information string.

Remarks

The Copyrights property is separate from the trademark information that is access by the Trademarks property.

Descriptions

Gets the description information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> Descriptions { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a description information string.

Remarks

The description information for a GlyphTypeface object can include revision notes, usage recommendations, history, features, as well as other information.

DesignerNames

Gets the designer information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> DesignerNames { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent designer information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a designer information string.

DesignerUrls

Gets the designer URL information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> DesignerUrls { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent designer information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that references a designer URL.

DistancesFromHorizontalBaselineToBlackBoxBottom

Gets the offset value from the horizontal Western baseline to the bottom of the glyph black box for the glyphs represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<ushort,double> DistancesFromHorizontalBaselineToBlackBoxBottom { get; }
Value
IDictionary<UInt16,Double>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent offsets for the glyphs. The key is a UInt16 that identifies the glyph index. The value is a Double that represents the offset value.

EmbeddingRights

Gets the font embedding permission for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Windows.Media.FontEmbeddingRight EmbeddingRights { get; }
Value
FontEmbeddingRight

One of the FontEmbeddingRight values that represents the font embedding permission

FaceNames

Gets the face name for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> FaceNames { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent face name information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string containing the face name.

Remarks

If the font file does not provide a name for the specified language, the FaceNames property returns the face name in English. The face name may identify weight, style, and/or stretch information.

FamilyNames

Gets the family name for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> FamilyNames { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent family name information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string containing the family name.

Remarks

If the font file does not provide a family name for the specified language, the FamilyNames property returns the family name in English. The family name excludes weight, style, and stretch information.

FontUri

Gets or sets the URI for the GlyphTypeface object.

public Uri FontUri { get; set; }
Value
Uri

The URI for the GlyphTypeface object.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

GlyphCount

Gets the number of glyphs for the GlyphTypeface object.

public int GlyphCount { get; }
Value
Int32

The total number of glyphs.

Height

Gets the height of the character cell relative to the em size.

public double Height { get; }
Value
Double

An Double value that represents the height of the character cell.

LeftSideBearings

Gets the distance from the leading end of the advance vector to the left edge of the black box for the glyphs represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<ushort,double> LeftSideBearings { get; }
Value
IDictionary<UInt16,Double>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information for the glyphs. The key is a UInt16 that identifies the glyph index. The value is a Double that represents the distance.

Remarks

The LeftSideBearings value is positive when the left edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance width and font cell height.

The LeftSideBearings value is negative when the left edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.

LicenseDescriptions

Gets the font license description information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> LicenseDescriptions { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs font license information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that describes the font license information.

ManufacturerNames

Gets the font manufacturer information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> ManufacturerNames { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs for the font manufacturer information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that describes the font manufacturer information.

RightSideBearings

Gets the distance from the right edge of the black box to the right end of the advance vector for the glyphs represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<ushort,double> RightSideBearings { get; }
Value
IDictionary<UInt16,Double>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information. The key is a UInt16 that identifies the glyph index. The value is a Double that represents the distance.

Remarks

The RightSideBearings value is positive when the trailing edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance width and font cell height.

The RightSideBearings value is negative when the right edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.

SampleTexts

Gets the sample text information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> SampleTexts { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs sample text information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that describes the sample text information.

Remarks

The SampleTexts value can be the font name, or any other text that the designer thinks is the best sample to display the font in.

Stretch

Gets the FontStretch value for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Windows.FontStretch Stretch { get; }
Value
FontStretch

A FontStretch value that represents the font stretch.

StrikethroughPosition

Gets a value that indicates the distance from the baseline to the strikethrough for the typeface.

public double StrikethroughPosition { get; }
Value
Double

A Double that represents the strikethrough position.

Remarks

The strikethrough position value is usually positive because the strikethrough is generally above the baseline.

StrikethroughThickness

Gets a value that indicates the thickness of the strikethrough relative to the font em size.

public double StrikethroughThickness { get; }
Value
Double

A Double that indicates the strikethrough thickness, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

Style

Gets the style for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Windows.FontStyle Style { get; }
Value
FontStyle

A FontStyle value that represents the style value.

StyleSimulations

Gets or sets the StyleSimulations for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Windows.Media.StyleSimulations StyleSimulations { get; set; }
Value
StyleSimulations

One of the StyleSimulations values that represents the style simulation for the font.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

Symbol

Gets a value that indicates whether the GlyphTypeface font conforms to Unicode encoding.

public bool Symbol { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the font conforms to Unicode encoding; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The font may be considered as a simple collection of symbols indexed by a code point.

TopSideBearings

Gets the distance from the top end of the vertical advance vector to the top edge of the black box for the glyphs represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<ushort,double> TopSideBearings { get; }
Value
IDictionary<UInt16,Double>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information. The key is a UInt16 that identifies the glyph index. The value is a Double that represents the distance.

Remarks

The TopSideBearings value is positive when the top edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance height and font cell height. The font cell height is a horizontal dimension in vertical layout.

The TopSideBearings value is negative when the top edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.

Trademarks

Gets the trademark notice information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> Trademarks { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent trademark notice information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that the trademark notice information.

Remarks

The Trademarks property is separate from the copyright information that is access by the Copyrights property.

UnderlinePosition

Gets the position of the underline in the GlyphTypeface.

public double UnderlinePosition { get; }
Value
Double

A Double value that represents the position of the underline.

Remarks

The underline position is relative to the baseline and relative to the em size. The returned position value is usually negative because an underline is usually below the baseline.

UnderlineThickness

Gets the thickness of the underline relative to em size.

public double UnderlineThickness { get; }
Value
Double

A value of type Double.

VendorUrls

Gets the vendor URL information for the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> VendorUrls { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent vendor URL information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that references a vendor URL.

Remarks

A font vendor could embed a unique serial number in the URL, which could then be used to register the font.

Version

Gets the font face version interpreted from the font's 'NAME' table.

public double Version { get; }
Value
Double

A Double value that represents the version.

VersionStrings

Gets the version string information for the GlyphTypeface object interpreted from the font's 'NAME' table.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> VersionStrings { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent version string information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that represents the version.

Remarks

Version strings vary significantly in format. To obtain the version as a numeric value, use the Version—do not attempt to parse the value of the VersionStrings property.

Weight

Gets the designed weight of the font represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Windows.FontWeight Weight { get; }
Value
FontWeight

A value of type FontWeight that represents the font weight.

Win32FaceNames

Gets the Win32 face name for the font represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> Win32FaceNames { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent Win32 face name information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that represents the Win32 face name.

Remarks

If the font does not provide a name for the specified language, it returns the face name in English. The Win32 face name may identify weights (other than regular or bold), and/or style, but may not identify stretch or other weights.

Win32FamilyNames

Gets the Win32 family name for the font represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.Globalization.CultureInfo,string> Win32FamilyNames { get; }
Value
IDictionary<CultureInfo,String>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 object that contains key/value pairs that represent Win32 family name information. The key is a CultureInfo object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that represents the Win32 family name.

Remarks

If the font does not provide a family name for the specified language, the Win32FamilyNames property returns the family name in English. The Win32 family name excludes regular or bold weights and style, but it includes other weights and stretch.

XHeight

Gets the Western x-height relative to em size for the font represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public double XHeight { get; }
Value
Double

A value of type Double.

Methods

ComputeSubset(ICollection<UInt16>)

Returns the binary image of the font subset based on a specified collection of glyphs.

public byte[] ComputeSubset (System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<ushort> glyphs);
glyphs
ICollection<UInt16>

The collection of glyph indices to be included in the subset.

Returns
Byte[]

A Byte array that represents the binary image of the font subset.

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current GlyphTypeface object.

public override bool Equals (object o);
o
System.Object

The Object to compare with the current GlyphTypeface object.

Returns
Boolean

true if o is a GlyphTypeface and is equal to the current GlyphTypeface; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two GlyphTypeface objects are considered equal if the StyleSimulations properties are equal.

GetFontStream()

Returns the font file stream represented by the GlyphTypeface object.

public System.IO.Stream GetFontStream ();
Returns
Stream

A Stream value that represents the font file.

GetGlyphOutline(UInt16,Double,Double)

Returns a Geometry value describing the path for a single glyph in the font.

public System.Windows.Media.Geometry GetGlyphOutline (ushort glyphIndex, double renderingEmSize, double hintingEmSize);
glyphIndex
UInt16

The index of the glyph to get the outline for.

renderingEmSize
Double

The font size in drawing surface units.

hintingEmSize
Double

The size to hint for in points.

Returns
Geometry

A Geometry value that represents the path of the glyph.

Remarks

The path represents the glyph without grid fitting applied for rendering at a specific resolution.

GetHashCode()

Serves as a hash function for GlyphTypeface.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

A hash code for the current object.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ISupportInitialize.BeginInit()

For a description of this member, see stem.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.BeginInit*.

void ISupportInitialize.BeginInit ();

ISupportInitialize.EndInit()

For a description of this member, see stem.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.EndInit*.

void ISupportInitialize.EndInit ();

rawMetadata.title: GlyphTypeface class | Microsoft Docs
rawMetadata.description: Specifies a physical font face that corresponds to a font file on the disk.
